snippet: More than half of water samples from about 150 public swimming pools in Atlanta contained traces of fecal matter, researchers at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found.
abstract: Researchers at Centers for Disease Control and Prevention say they have found that 58 percent of water samples from about 150 public swimming pools in Atlanta contained E coli bacteria, an indicator of feces in the water; say level of contamination is most likely similar to levels across country.
lead_paragraph: More than half of water samples from about 150 public swimming pools in Atlanta contained traces of fecal matter, researchers at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found.

headline.seo: Fecal Matter Found in Public Pools
